Package image

Class HeightMap

java.lang.Object
image.HeightMap
public class HeightMap
extends java.lang.Object
Convert 1-channel grey scale image to a 16-bit 1-channel raw heightmap This class is designed convert an image file into a .raw file that can be imported by Unity for use with terrain generation. The target heightmap file is a single channel, 16-bit, .raw height resolution map. Image is expected to be somewhat of a maze where the walls are colored black with everything else being white
Since:
2020-07-01
Version:
1.0
Author:
Martin Edmunds

    • HeightMap

      public HeightMap​(java.lang.String filename) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Constructor: attempts to load file for processing
      Parameters:
      filename - The image file to attempt to be loaded
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - on missing file
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - on heightmap conversion error

    • HeightMap

      public HeightMap​(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img) throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException, java.lang.NullPointerException
      Constructor: attempts to build heightmap directly from a buffered image
      Parameters:
      img - BufferedImage to be converted to heightmap
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - on heightmap conversion error
      java.lang.NullPointerException - on invalid img

  • Method Details

    • GenerateMap

      public void GenerateMap() throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Constructs the heightmap of the image. Format of the heightmap is a 16-bit 1-channel raw file.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException

    • GetHeightmap

      public byte[] GetHeightmap()
      Returns raw byte heightmap
      Returns:
      byte[] heightmap raw

      Throws:
